snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg discussed new proposals related to police stops and the environment, as well as his accomplishments during 11 years in office.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg gives his 12th and final State of the City address, an unabashed tribute to his own municipal stewardship and vision for New York City; he warns that era of political independence during his tenure could end with his departure,  suggesting that lobbyists, unions and campaign donors might retake their previous powerful places in government.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and MICHAEL BARBARO

lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg discussed new proposals related to police stops and the environment, as well as his accomplishments during 11 years in office.

headline.seo: Bloomberg, in Last Annual Address, Cites Gains and Goals
headline.main: From Bloomberg, a Warning of Life After Bloomberg
headline.print_headline: From Bloomberg, a Warning of Life After Bloomberg
